title: اختبار .NET Team Lead & Solution Architect
description: A practice test with multiple-choice and true/false questions covering .NET leadership, architecture, cloud, design patterns, DevOps, and enterprise engineering.

questions.text: Which .NET runtime is cross-platform and optimized for high-performance server applications?
questions.explanation: .NET Core is the modern, cross-platform runtime used for high-performance and cloud applications.

questions.text: What design pattern is commonly used to decouple an interface from its implementation?
questions.explanation: DI provides a way to supply dependencies externally, improving testability and modularity.

questions.text: Which architectural style encourages splitting systems into independently deployable services?
questions.explanation: Microservices promote independent deployment and scaling of services.

questions.text: Which Azure service is most commonly used for hosting containerized .NET microservices?
questions.explanation: AKS is fully managed Kubernetes for container orchestration at scale.

questions.text: Which HTTP method should be used when updating a resource partially?
questions.explanation: PATCH is used for partial updates while PUT replaces the full resource.

questions.text: Clean Architecture enforces separation of concerns through concentric layers.
questions.explanation: Clean Architecture organizes code into concentric layers to isolate dependencies.

questions.text: Async/await improves throughput by increasing CPU utilization.
questions.explanation: Async/await improves scalability by freeing threads, not by increasing CPU usage.

questions.text: A .NET solution architect should prioritize coupling over cohesion.
questions.explanation: Good architecture favors low coupling and high cohesion.

questions.text: Entity Framework Core supports both LINQ and raw SQL queries.
questions.explanation: EF Core supports raw SQL via FromSql and LINQ for ORM-based querying.

questions.text: Azure Service Bus is used for real-time streaming analytics.
questions.explanation: Azure Event Hub is used for streaming analytics, not Service Bus.

questions.text: Which of the following is the main benefit of CQRS architecture?
answers: Combines reads and writes in a single model
Separates read and write models for scaling
questions.correctAnswer: Separates read and write models for scaling
questions.explanation: CQRS separates read/write models allowing scaling and independent optimization.

questions.text: Which logging provider is built into ASP.NET Core?
questions.explanation: ILogger is the built-in abstraction for logging in ASP.NET Core.

questions.text: In .NET, what keyword is used to ensure resources are disposed automatically?
questions.explanation: The using statement ensures IDisposable objects are cleaned up.

questions.text: Which REST principle requires that each request must contain all necessary information to process it?
questions.explanation: REST APIs must be stateless, meaning no client context stored on the server.

questions.text: Which Azure service is best suited for hosting serverless .NET functions?
questions.explanation: Azure Functions is a serverless compute platform.

questions.text: What is the command to create a new ASP.NET Core Web API project?
questions.explanation: This command scaffolds a new Web API template.

questions.text: Which pattern helps aggregate multiple repositories under a single abstraction?
questions.explanation: Unit of Work coordinates multiple repositories into a single transactional unit.

questions.text: Which Azure database is recommended for distributed, planet-scale applications?
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB is globally distributed with low-latency multi-region replication.

questions.text: Which NuGet package is required for Entity Framework Core migrations?
questions.explanation: Tools package provides CLI commands for migrations.

questions.text: Which DevOps practice ensures code is always in a deployable state?
questions.explanation: CI ensures the codebase is kept healthy and buildable.

questions.text: SOLID principles were introduced to improve maintainability and scalability.
questions.explanation: SOLID principles aim to create cleaner, more modular systems.

questions.text: In .NET, a struct is a reference type.
questions.explanation: Structs are value types.

questions.text: ASP.NET Core middleware executes in a pipeline sequentially.
questions.explanation: Middleware runs in the order registered.

questions.text: The Builder pattern is used to create objects step by step.
questions.explanation: Builder helps construct complex objects incrementally.

questions.text: gRPC is faster than REST for internal service communication.
questions.explanation: gRPC uses binary protocol over HTTP/2 providing high performance.

questions.text: What is the default serialization format in ASP.NET Core Web API?
questions.explanation: ASP.NET Core uses System.Text.Json for default JSON serialization.

questions.text: Which technique helps protect APIs against excessive request loads?
questions.explanation: Rate limiting prevents abuse by throttling requests.

questions.text: Which messaging pattern ensures that each message is processed exactly once?
questions.explanation: Exactly-once semantics guarantee a single processing of messages.

questions.text: Which cloud concept refers to scaling based on demand?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows automatic scaling of resources based on load.

questions.text: Which .NET feature helps minimize memory allocation by reusing objects?
questions.explanation: Object and array pools reduce GC pressure.

questions.text: Which protocol does SignalR use for real-time communication?
questions.explanation: SignalR uses WebSockets when available for low-latency communication.

questions.text: Which Azure service is used for distributed caching?
questions.explanation: Redis provides fast in-memory caching.

questions.text: Which .NET feature is essential for unit testing code with external dependencies?
questions.explanation: DI allows replacing real services with mocks for testing.

questions.text: What is the primary benefit of containerization?
questions.explanation: Containers enable portable and reproducible application environments.

questions.text: Which of the following is a recommended branching strategy?
questions.explanation: Gitflow is a structured workflow suitable for enterprise development.

questions.text: Which database pattern stores events instead of current state?
questions.explanation: Event Sourcing stores events; the state is rebuilt from these events.

questions.text: Which concurrency model is recommended for high-scale .NET services?
questions.explanation: Async I/O frees threads and improves scalability.

questions.text: Which approach helps avoid circular dependencies in architecture?
questions.explanation: Interfaces help decouple modules and prevent circular dependencies.

questions.text: Which type of testing validates service boundaries in microservices?
questions.explanation: Integration tests verify communication across service boundaries.

questions.text: Which version control concept allows multiple developers to work on the same codebase simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Branching allows developers to work independently.

questions.text: Which HTTP status code indicates successful resource creation?
questions.explanation: 201 Created is returned when a new resource is successfully created.

questions.text: Which database strategy improves read performance in microservices?
questions.explanation: Read replicas distribute read load across multiple servers.

questions.text: Which tool is commonly used for code analysis in .NET?
questions.explanation: SonarQube performs static code analysis and quality checks.

questions.text: Which Azure service handles secret, key, and certificate storage?
questions.explanation: Key Vault is used to store secrets securely.

questions.text: What does DDD stand for?
questions.explanation: DDD is an architectural and strategic domain modeling methodology.

questions.text: Which architectural concept groups domain logic around a specific business capability?
questions.explanation: A bounded context isolates domain models around business capabilities.

questions.text: Which communication approach reduces coupling between microservices?
questions.explanation: Events decouple services and improve scalability.

questions.text: Which containerization tool is the standard for building and running containers?
questions.explanation: Docker is the most widely used container engine.

questions.text: Which approach helps reduce downtime during deployments?
questions.explanation: Blue-green deployment reduces downtime by switching traffic between two environments.

questions.text: Which monitoring approach tracks logs, metrics, and traces across distributed systems?
questions.explanation: Distributed tracing captures end-to-end request flow across microservices.

questions.text: Which feature in ASP.NET Core allows for handling cross-cutting concerns like logging and authentication?
questions.explanation: Filters run before or after actions and are ideal for cross-cutting concerns.

questions.text: Which .NET GC mode is optimized for high-throughput server applications?
questions.explanation: Server GC is optimized for multi-core scalability and server workloads.

questions.text: Which container orchestrator integrates natively with Azure?
questions.explanation: AKS is Azure's managed Kubernetes service.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of API Gateways in microservices?
questions.explanation: API Gateways route requests, provide composition, and centralize cross-cutting concerns.

questions.text: Which pattern helps in managing failures in distributed systems?
questions.explanation: Circuit Breaker prevents repeated calls to failing systems.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides distributed messaging with pub/sub?
questions.explanation: Service Bus Topics implement pub/sub messaging.

questions.text: Which ORM feature helps reduce round trips to the database?
questions.explanation: Eager loading retrieves related data in a single query.

questions.text: Which deployment model isolates microservices at the infrastructure level?
questions.explanation: Containers isolate services and provide independent deployments.

questions.text: Which .NET collection provides O(1) average lookup time?
questions.explanation: Dictionary is a hash-based key/value collection with fast lookups.

questions.text: Which log format is best for distributed systems?
questions.explanation: Structured logs improve indexing and searching in distributed systems.

questions.text: Which pipeline tool is built into Azure DevOps?
questions.explanation: Azure Pipelines provide CI/CD automation.

questions.text: Which protocol is used for contract-first RPC-based communication?
questions.explanation: gRPC uses Protocol Buffers for contract-first communication.

questions.text: Which Azure component is essential for zero-downtime deployments?
questions.explanation: Slots support blue/green deployments with zero downtime.

questions.text: Which software model places domain rules at the core of the application?
questions.explanation: Clean Architecture puts the domain/core layer at the center.

questions.text: Which pattern helps avoid duplicating business logic across multiple services?
questions.explanation: Shared Kernel contains shared domain logic in bounded contexts.

questions.text: What is the recommended method to expose an internal microservice securely?
questions.explanation: Private networking ensures secure internal-only access.

questions.text: Which Azure storage type is optimized for massive unstructured data?
questions.explanation: Blob storage is ideal for unstructured data.

questions.text: Which DDD building block defines rules and operations belonging to the domain?
questions.explanation: Entities contain domain logic and identifiers.

questions.text: Which type of caching stores data close to business logic?
questions.explanation: In-memory cache provides ultra-fast access within the application.

questions.text: Which deployment pattern uses two parallel production environments?
questions.explanation: Two environments allow quick switching for zero downtime.

questions.text: Which ASP.NET Core component is responsible for resolving service dependencies?
questions.explanation: IServiceProvider creates and supplies registered services.

questions.text: Which serialization format is used by gRPC?
questions.explanation: Protocol Buffers provide compact and fast serialization.

questions.text: Which authentication approach is recommended for SPAs?
questions.explanation: OIDC is standard for SPA authentication with token-based auth.

questions.text: Which Azure service improves global availability using edge locations?
questions.explanation: Front Door uses edge POPs for global load balancing and acceleration.

questions.text: Which pattern ensures operations complete even when external systems fail temporarily?
questions.explanation: Retry automatically repeats failed operations based on rules.

questions.text: Which data structure is best for maintaining ordering while providing fast traversal?
questions.explanation: LinkedList maintains order with fast insertions and deletions.

questions.text: Which tool is recommended for managing secrets in CI/CD pipelines?
questions.explanation: Key Vault secures secrets and integrates with DevOps pipelines.

questions.text: Which metric indicates how long a request spends waiting in a queue?
questions.explanation: Queue time measures delay before processing begins.

questions.text: Which pattern delegates a request through a chain of handlers?
questions.explanation: This pattern passes requests through multiple handlers.

questions.text: Which Azure database service supports multi-master writes?
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB supports multi-master and multi-region writes.

questions.text: Which file format is used to write infrastructure as code for Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure ARM and Bicep are IaC languages for Azure resources.

questions.text: Which parallel programming feature divides CPU-bound workloads?
questions.explanation: Parallel loops divide work across threads for CPU-bound operations.

questions.text: Which DDD building block ensures data consistency within an aggregate?
questions.explanation: Aggregate roots enforce business invariants.

questions.text: Which type of scaling adds more instances of an application?
questions.explanation: Horizontal scaling adds more nodes/instances.

questions.text: Which .NET API is used for cryptographic hashing?
questions.explanation: SHA256 creates secure hash values.

questions.text: Which Azure service caches static content globally?
questions.explanation: Azure CDN distributes static assets via global POPs.

questions.text: Which testing level ensures the entire system behaves as expected?
questions.explanation: E2E tests validate the system as a whole.

questions.text: Which .NET feature allows runtime type inspection?
questions.explanation: Reflection inspects types and members at runtime.

questions.text: Which CI/CD step installs dependencies and compiles the code?
questions.explanation: Build step compiles and restores dependencies.

questions.text: Which .NET API is used to perform HTTP calls?
questions.explanation: HttpClient is the standard API for HTTP requests.

questions.text: In .NET, async methods always run on background threads.
questions.explanation: Async does not guarantee running on background threads; it's about non-blocking I/O.

questions.text: With microservices, each service should have its own database.
questions.explanation: Database-per-service ensures isolation and loose coupling.

questions.text: Value objects in DDD are immutable.
questions.explanation: Immutability is a key feature of value objects.

questions.text: Feature flags allow enabling and disabling features without redeployment.
questions.explanation: Feature flags decouple deployment from release.

questions.text: JWT tokens must always be stored in local storage.
questions.explanation: Local storage is vulnerable; HTTP-only cookies are safer.

questions.text: Scaling up involves increasing resources of the same server.
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling adds more power to the same instance.

questions.text: Unit tests should not access real databases.
questions.explanation: Real DB access belongs to integration tests.

questions.text: CQRS can be used without Event Sourcing.
questions.explanation: CQRS and Event Sourcing are independent patterns.

questions.text: In .NET, middleware is executed after MVC filters.
questions.explanation: Middleware runs before reaching MVC filters.

questions.text: Container images should be built using minimal base images for security.
questions.explanation: Minimal images reduce attack surface.

questions.text: Which SharePoint Online component is primarily responsible for managing global navigation and multi-geo tenant configurations?
questions.explanation: Hub sites centralize navigation and organizational structure, supporting multi-geo deployments.

questions.text: Which storage model does SharePoint Online primarily use for document metadata?
questions.explanation: SharePoint Online metadata is stored in Azure SQL for transactional storage and structured data.

questions.text: In a SharePoint Framework (SPFx) solution, which component controls the web part lifecycle?
questions.explanation: The BaseClientSideWebPart class manages initialization, rendering, and disposal.

questions.text: Which authentication method is recommended for server-to-server automation against SharePoint Online?
questions.explanation: Certificate-based auth is secure and recommended for enterprise automation using Azure AD apps.

questions.text: Which service controls Search Indexing in SharePoint Online?
questions.explanation: Microsoft Search powers indexing and unified search across M365 workloads.

questions.text: Which SharePoint Online feature allows offloading large files to external storage while keeping metadata in SharePoint?
questions.explanation: RBS offloads file streams to external storage, reducing DB size.

questions.text: What is the default maximum file size supported in SharePoint Online?
questions.explanation: Microsoft increased the limit to 250 GB for SPO and OneDrive.

questions.text: Which tool is best for modern SharePoint Online ALM automation?
questions.explanation: PnP PowerShell is the modern automation toolkit for SharePoint Online.

questions.text: Which service enables site-level retention labels for governance and compliance?
questions.explanation: Purview applies retention labels and compliance features across Microsoft 365.

questions.text: Which SharePoint component stores taxonomy and term groups?
questions.explanation: MMS stores enterprise taxonomy and term sets for metadata-driven navigation.

questions.text: Which deployment model supports global performance optimization for large-scale SharePoint portals?
questions.explanation: CDNs reduce latency and increase performance for global users.

questions.text: SharePoint Online supports full trust farm solutions.
questions.explanation: Farm solutions are deprecated and not supported in SharePoint Online.

questions.text: Modern Search in SharePoint Online can index content from external data sources using Graph Connectors.
questions.explanation: Microsoft Graph Connectors enable indexing external systems.

questions.text: SharePoint Online allows disabling modern UI for the entire tenant.
questions.explanation: Modern UI is default and cannot be globally disabled.

questions.text: Syntex can automatically classify and extract metadata from files using AI models.
questions.explanation: Syntex uses machine learning for classification and metadata extraction.

questions.text: SharePoint Online supports unlimited subsites in a site collection.
questions.explanation: Modern SharePoint promotes flat architecture over deep subsite structures.

questions.text: Microsoft recommends hub site-to-hub site associations for cross-organization navigation.
questions.explanation: Hub-to-hub associations are not supported; only nested global navigation via home sites.

questions.text: SharePoint Search respects security trimming at the item level.
questions.explanation: Search only returns items a user is permitted to view.

questions.text: Hybrid search requires a Cloud SSA (Search Service Application) to be configured.
questions.explanation: Cloud SSA enables hybrid search between SharePoint Server and Online.

questions.text: SharePoint Online supports custom master pages in modern sites.
questions.explanation: Modern SharePoint restricts master page customization to preserve responsiveness and updates.

questions.text: SPFx web parts can run on classic SharePoint pages.
questions.explanation: SPFx is compatible with both classic and modern sites.

questions.text: Which Power Platform component is primarily responsible for building low-code automation workflows?
questions.explanation: Power Automate builds low-code automation for workflows across Microsoft 365 and external systems.

questions.text: Which Azure service is ideal for hosting globally distributed JSON-based applications?
questions.explanation: Cosmos DB provides global distribution, low latency, and schema-flexible JSON storage.

questions.text: Which DevOps practice ensures infrastructure is created and maintained programmatically?
questions.explanation: IaC ensures environment consistency by managing infrastructure via code.

questions.text: In Azure AD, which OAuth flow is recommended for daemon/background applications?
questions.explanation: Client credentials enable server-to-server authentication without user interaction.

questions.text: Which Power BI feature enables row-level security across large datasets?
questions.explanation: Row-level security restricts data visibility per user.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides automatic scaling for hosting .NET web applications?
questions.explanation: App Services support auto-scaling for web application workloads.

questions.text: Which tool is best suited for building CI/CD pipelines for SharePoint Framework (SPFx)?
questions.explanation: GitHub Actions supports Node.js pipelines and NPM tasks required for SPFx.

questions.text: Which Azure service is commonly used as a middleware integration layer for SharePoint Online automations?
questions.explanation: Functions can create serverless endpoints triggered by SharePoint webhooks or Power Automate.

questions.text: Which Microsoft tool is recommended to automate provisioning modern SharePoint sites with templates?
questions.explanation: PnP templates enable automated creation of SPO sites with structure and content.

questions.text: Which Azure network feature secures App Service outbound traffic to specific destinations?
questions.explanation: Private Endpoints secure communication through private IPs.

questions.text: Which Azure service monitors SharePoint Online and M365 user activity with real-time alerts?
questions.explanation: Sentinel integrates M365 logs for threat detection and analytics.

questions.text: Azure Logic Apps can connect directly to SharePoint Online using built-in connectors.
questions.explanation: Logic Apps include SharePoint connectors for file and list operations.

questions.text: Power Apps Canvas apps can only connect to Microsoft 365 services.
questions.explanation: Canvas apps connect to hundreds of connectors including SQL, Dataverse, Salesforce, etc.

questions.text: Azure DevOps can deploy SPFx solutions to SharePoint App Catalog automatically.
questions.explanation: DevOps pipelines can publish SPFx packages via PnP PowerShell.

questions.text: Azure Functions can be triggered by a SharePoint Webhook.
questions.explanation: SharePoint sends webhook notifications to HTTP-triggered Functions.

questions.text: Power BI Premium is required for paginated reports.
questions.explanation: Paginated reports require premium capacity for rendering.

questions.text: SharePoint Online supports executing custom server-side code.
questions.explanation: Server-side code is blocked; SPFx and client-side solutions are required.

questions.text: Azure API Management can act as a gateway for SharePoint Online API calls.
questions.explanation: APIM can proxy and secure outbound calls from SPFx or Power Apps.

questions.text: Azure Blob Storage can serve SPFx web part assets as a CDN.
questions.explanation: SPFx build allows CDN deployment and Azure Blob Storage is commonly used.

questions.text: Power Automate cannot update SharePoint document metadata.
questions.explanation: Power Automate can update list item metadata and file properties.

questions.text: Azure Monitor can collect telemetry for SharePoint Framework (SPFx) web parts.
questions.explanation: SPFx can send custom telemetry to Application Insights, part of Azure Monitor.
